POSITION SUMMARY:The primary responsibility of this position is to operate as the subject matter expert (SME) over the reporting and analysis process related to Leave Management through the Kronos Leave Module, Leave of Absence (LOA) Tool, SAP, and any other added leave management systems. The position provides regularly scheduled reporting and analysis findings on LOA metrics and ways to identify efficiencies and process improvements, as well as application of process improvements to current processes. This position will also manage a small caseload of leaves and LOA administration tasks as a backup to other LOA analysts.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Develop scheduled and adhoc reports and queries based on leadership, legal, HR, and
other internal stakeholder requests
  • Develop strong analytical processes that create efficiencies, process improvements, cost
savings, and waste elimination
  • Identify compliance gaps through robust audit processes
  • Resolve and document system-related issues reported by leave management team
members
  • Resolve issues from error reports and develop processes to reduce future errors
  • Develop and deliver ongoing system training to leave management team members
  • Lead and manage LOA team projects; duties include, but are not limited to, project
planning, discovery, task creation and assignment, timeline management, system testing,

and implementation
  • Provide metric dashboards to leadership team members to share with business units
  • Manage leave of absence case load of approximately 100 leave cases
  • Fully participates in continuous improvement (NCE) and is responsible for driving
improvements through NCE activities and initiatives.
  • Performs all other duties as assigned
SUPERVISION RECEIVED:

Minimal

SUPERVISION GIVEN:

None

FINANCIAL/STRATEGIC IMPACT:

Assists the business in maintaining compliance with all federal, state, and local leave laws, as well as discovering and implementing efficiencies through system analysis and reporting.

Qualifications

REQUIREMENTS AND MINIMUM EDUCATION LEVEL:
  • High School diploma required, Bachelor's degree preferred, specifically in Business, HRIS,
Human Resources, or related field
  • Strong HRIS systems understanding & technical aptitude; expert level ability in Microsoft
Excel (i.e. vlookups, pivot tables, and other types of formatting/formulas) and proficient in

all other Microsoft Office applications

EXPERIENCE:
  • 2+ years of experience in HR or Benefits data management, or related position; experience
must include HR system administration, preferably within SAP or similar system preferred
  • 1 year prior experience managing leaves of absence preferred
  • Payroll experience preferred, specifically in Kronos timekeeping system
SKILLS:
  • Ability to analyze and extract data utilizing HRIS systems with attention to detail
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and take initiative
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively in a diverse, team
environment
  • Strong verbal and written communication
  • Strong sense of urgency and ability to handle pressure and demands from multiple
customers and competing priorities
  • Ability to take on other programs, projects, and tasks as assigned with minimal disruption to
daily activities
  • Ability to handle sensitive employee information in a confidential manner
  • Project management and vendor management skills
  • Ability to focus on customer needs in a fast-paced environment
The Nestlé Companies are equal employment and affirmative action employers and looking for diversity in qualified candidates for employment.
